New Records: Cape Verde secured their place in the Africa Cup of Nations quarter-finals after defeating Mauritania 1-0.
Mauritania reached the tournament’s knockout stages for the first time by defeating Algeria 1-0 in their final group game.
Key Match Events: Ryan Mendes converted a late penalty in the 88th minute to give Cape Verde the win.
Omare Gassama was substituted after being carried off on a stretcher in the 35th minute.
Cape Verde's Garry Rodrigues and Mendes forced Mauritania goalkeeper Babacar Niasse into excellent saves.
Yassin El Welly’s misplaced header led to a penalty for Cape Verde in the 87th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Cape Verde captain Ryan Mendes praised the team’s resilience after the match.
Mauritania coach highlighted their historical achievement of reaching the knockout stage for the first time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was end-to-end with clear-cut chances at a premium early on.
Cape Verde’s strong finish in the closing stages was pivotal to their victory.
